title: Riot With excuses. Riot Banning innocent players.

replies.body:
> retaliation is _**almost**_ the same as defending yourself

There is a somewhat grey line there I'll admit, but consider it this way: 
___
**Player:** Stop fking feeding you trashlord.
**You**: I'm not feeding/It's just a bad game/No/It's not intentional

Any variation there of is fine, you are defending yourself. It isn't going to help you any, they aren't going to care and if anything are going to flame you more, but it's perfectly ok.
___
**Player:** Stop fking feeding you trashlord.
**You**: Go drink bleach/fk you you piece of shit/screw you _expletive here_/go die

Not ok.
___
The difference between defending yourself and retaliation is essentially the moment you cross the line into toxic territory, regardless of the integrity of the target. Being provoked _**might **_ net you a more lenient punishment, or give you a bit of leeway for fairly mundane responses like "fk you" so long as it isn't excessive and depending on the circumstance. That said, the moment you target that kind of negativity at a player it doesn't matter in the slightest who started it. 

It is at that point where you are past being frustrated at someone talking shit about you, and you are proving that you yourself are also a negative player. 

And sometimes it isn't as clear cut for sure. Over the course of a game usually how that behaviour continues or doesn't is evidence enough for or against the player. When it doesn't, that's when reports, context and manual reviews come in.
You didn't actually read what I wrote. You only stated the obvious.
I read your post. You tried to claim that the retaliator is innocent and should not be punished. This is false
You're so arrogant it's not even funny.  It is not false. lmao

I did read your post, your argument was that a) toxic players reports shouldn't count against innocent victims, and b) that those that retaliate are innocent. 

As far as a) is concerned, no players reports count against an innocent, if the reportee is innocent the report is thrown out, regardless of the standing of the reporter.
And I addressed b) in my response, explaining why those that retaliate are not innocent by virtue of the difference between defense and retaliation.

I may have been stating the obvious, but you were the one claiming those that retaliate are innocent victims. Victims, yes. Innocent, no.
They are innocent, because they are victims. simple.

If a person is guilty of an unacceptable behaviour then they are punishable. If someone on the other side of things demonstrates that same behaviour, then they are also guilty of that behaviour and therefore punishable.

The second they cross the line from defending themselves (frustratedly or otherwise) into unaccepted negative behaviour of their own, they are no longer innocent. Still a victim, but no innocent. Just as the one that started it is still guilty but also now a victim.

"He started it so I shouldn't be punished for punching him" is the logic applied by children, not teens-adults who are expected to know how to take full responsibility for their actions.
Someone being a victim doesn't automatically mean they are innocent. A person can be victimised by someone else and still be at fault.
omg. that is all. just... omg

By retaliating you are basically becoming one of the toxic players. Look, I see your point but take it this way. Person 1 and Person 2 are playing a game say basketball and Person 2 gets pissed because he is losing. Person 2 punches Person 1 and Person 1 retaliates so on and so forth. However, if Person 1 walked away and told a teacher (in this case, reporting the player) Person 2 would be in trouble but Person 1 would not be in trouble because he did not do anything. What i'm trying to say is, instead of retaliating, just mute the person and carry on with the game and then reporting him for toxicity after the game.

Dude you're speaking like you've never played sport? This is a really bad example & is exactly my point. If someone hits you in sport, you drop them. They won't be coming back to play. This is how the system should work instead of an on going cycle of regurgitation of bull shit.
I do play sports and whenever I get hit I just walk away and continue with the game, I don't drop no one cause I wanna avoid fights and stuff. It's called being matured

Mature to your own individual standard. That's entirely your opinion. You want to run and avoid situations, go ahead but i'll stick around to try sort the real issues out, so that it doesn't happen again.

Who's innocent? If you retaliate by flaming, trolling and straight up being a dick, you should be reported.

Your actions are your own, and can not be blamed on another. 

Own your mistakes and move on
reports that have no basis don't go through, unless they actually have done something report worthy.

Breaking the rules is breaking the rules, doesn't matter if the person you're "flaming" has broken the rules. Another person actions don't excuse yours. *You* break the rules, *you* take the punishment, same as everyone else.
This mind set is so flawed on many different levels. I don't even dare try and educate you.
Says the guy trying to claim innocence on *intentionally* toxic players...
This is your opinion. You not understanding why toxicity will never end is the exact problem lmao.

I understand perfectly well that toxicity will never be eliminated completely, but saying that someone should be allowed to be toxic because that's how they've been treated is a load of cr*p and only contributes to the problem. If you can't see that then there is no reason for you to be part of the community.
bye
